intro: Sium cordiennii, commonly known as the heartleaf water dropwort, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes many aromatic herbs and vegetables. The plant is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves and small, white to greenish flowers that appear in umbels. It typically grows in moist, shady environments such as stream banks and wet meadows. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species in some areas.
